creditline: Minnesota Historical Society Collections, Gift of Miss Maude G. Stewart to the Sibley House Association, 1938
description: MHS L1997.19.13; box (.1a,b)  brown with black diamond design; black image of scissors on lid; print of a man and woman inside lid; removable brass tray; hinged lid; objects inside box  piece of wood (.2); piece of wood with thread wrapped around it (.3); white thread spool (.4); 'Mother' embroidery sample (.5); pin (.6); unfinished piece of crochet with three circles (.7)
dimension: .1a,b (box): H.4 x W.12-7/8 x D.9-1/4 in. (overall)
text: This box, which has compartments for sewing needles, pins, and thread, was once owned by Adelaide Skillman, who was probably descended from the family of Francis M. Skillman. Born in Riverhead, Long Island, New York, Skillman and his sons Evander and Philip came from Chenango County, New York to Wabasha County, Minnesota, in 1856.
title: Workbox
